channel.title: How can I jar my Eclipse Client [PI]?
channel.description: Im having a proplem with jarring im getting error connecting to server please report can anyone post a link for a turtoial about jaring?

item.title: How can I jar my Eclipse Client [PI]?
item.dc:creator: @Adam200214 Adam200214
item.description:
@Adam200214 wrote:

Error connecting to server means the client can’t connect to the ip, to change this goto gui.java or client.java depending on your source… change the ip to 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 to set it to offline mode so only you can access it or your/no-ip ip so others can access it…

Pm me if you need any more help.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I jar my Eclipse Client [PI]?

item.title: How can I jar my Eclipse Client [PI]?
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

Ok, I will tell it you in steps.
Step 1. Goto your client in eclipse
Step 2. Rightmouse button on your client
Step 3. Click export.
Step 4. Select Java > Runnable jar file.
Step 5. Click next.
Step 6. At launch configuration select the main class(If that is how it’s called) of your client.
Step 7. Choose your export destination. The place doesn’t matter.
Step 8. Library handling > Extract required libraries into generated JAR.(That’s what i always choose, idk if that’s good.)
Step 9. Click finish.
Step 10. Go to the place where your export destination is and open the JAR.

Well, that’s it I guess.

Read full topic
